_comments.description: Sample Claude Desktop MCP configuration for Yandex MCP Server
installation: 1. Copy this configuration structure to your Claude Desktop config file:
2. Update the 'args' array with the absolute path to your built server file
3. Replace 'your_yandex_oauth_token_here' with your actual Yandex OAuth token
4. For Python implementation, change 'command' to 'python' or 'python3'
5. Restart Claude Desktop for changes to take effect

fields.command: The executable to run (node, python, python3, or absolute path to binary)
fields.args: Array of command-line arguments. Must include absolute path to server entry point
fields.env: Environment variables passed to the server process. Add your OAuth token here
fields.disabled: Set to true to temporarily disable this MCP server without removing the config
fields.alwaysAllow: Array of tool names that should be auto-approved without user confirmation

security: ⚠️  NEVER commit this file with real tokens to version control
⚠️  Restrict OAuth token scopes to minimum required permissions

troubleshooting.server_not_appearing: Check JSON syntax, verify absolute paths, restart Claude Desktop
troubleshooting.authentication_errors: Verify token is valid and has required scopes/permissions
troubleshooting.server_crashes: Check Claude Desktop logs, enable debug logging, verify dependencies installed
troubleshooting.permission_denied: Ensure OAuth token has necessary scopes for the operations you're performing
